section.title: Introduction
section.p: The restore operation corresponds to a move operation from an area, trash or archive, to the authoring

ul.li: the area for the source document
the document id for the source document

section.title: Delete screen
section.source: <map:match pattern="restore" type="usecase"> <map:match pattern="showscreen" type="step"> <map:generate src="content/info/restore.xsp" type="serverpages"/> <map:transform src="xslt/info/restore.xsl"> <map:parameter name="use-request-parameters" value="true"/> </map:transform> <map:call resource="style-cms-page"/> </map:match> </map:match>
section.p: The parameters for the source are get with the serverpage through the page envelope input module. The destination document id is computed in the serverpage from the identifier. The destination source is set to area in the stylesheet. A form (build with the xslt transformation) sends then the parameters as request parameters with the new URL.

section.title: Restore confirmation
section.source: <map:match pattern="restore" type="usecase"> <map:match pattern="restore" type="step"> <map:act type="task"> <map:redirect-to session="true" uri="{request:contextPath}/{../../../1}/{../../../2}/"/> </map:act> </map:match> </map:match>
section.p: The action org.apache.lenya.cms.cocoon.acting.TaskAction calls the execution of the ant task.

section.title: Ant Task
section.p: The ant target restoreDocument is in the publication :
The target for the restore operation depends on the different targets

ul.li: firstareaproperties, to set the needed properties dependent of the area of the source
secareaproperties, to set the needed properties dependent of the area of the destination
newcopydocumentid, to compute the unique destination id (Same logic like for the copy operation).
firstdocumentpath, to compute the directory of the contents for the source (Needed for the revisions and the rcml files)
secdocumentpath, to compute the directory where are the contents for the destination (Needed for the revisions and the rcml files)
move, to execute the different move operations

section.p: More about ant task, see the documentation Ant Task and the Javadoc
